item.title: Someone is continually knocking down the concrete posts, 23rd February
item.description:
The 3rd concrete bollard has been knocked into. Two are lose and my husband has to keep moving the bollards off the road where children or others are letting them go into the road. They could easily cause an accident. I've already had to call 999 where the bollards are rolling into the roads. It's has been like this with at least one for 6 months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 166, Rectory Lane, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes, 23rd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Manchester Square, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp metal bollards on Rivington St | INJURY, 23rd February
item.description:
There are two metal bollards on Rivington Street that have extremely sharp edges and are a public danger. I accidentally bumped into one on Friday at 7pm and it deeply cut my hand open, requiring 3 stitches and a tetanus jab at A&E.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rivington Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
